Oh, that God would help in this crisis of our work, is my daily prayer. In Sydney, after the camp meeting is over, there should be the most discreet workers. Wise men should be left in charge to do personal work. Strength should not be wasted in the coming meeting by stretching them into the 


                                    -342- 

night and exhausting the vitality of the ministerial workers. They are thus left shorn of spiritual and physical vitality.
